content:
UIElementAutomationPeer Class

In this Article

Exposes UIElement types to UI Automation.

Syntax

Declaration

public class UIElementAutomationPeer : System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • DispatcherObject
  • System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer
  • UIElementAutomationPeer

Constructors summary

UIElementAutomationPeer(UIElement)

Initializes a new instance of the UIElementAutomationPeer class.

Properties summary

Owner

Gets the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer.

Methods summary

CreatePeerForElement(UIElement)

Creates a UIElementAutomationPeer for the specified UIElement.
FromElement(UIElement)

Gets the UIElementAutomationPeer for the specified UIElement.
GetAcceleratorKeyCore()

Gets the accelerator key for the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAcceleratorKey*.
GetAccessKeyCore()

Gets the access key for the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer.This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAccessKey*.
GetAutomationControlTypeCore()

Gets the control type for the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationControlType*.
GetAutomationIdCore()

Gets the string that uniquely identifies the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationId*.
GetBoundingRectangleCore()

Gets the Rect that represents the bounding rectangle of the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetBoundingRectangle*.
GetChildrenCore()

Gets the collection of child elements of the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildren*.
GetClassNameCore()

Gets the name of the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClassName*.
GetClickablePointCore()

Gets a Point that represents the clickable space that is on the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClickablePoint*.
GetHelpTextCore()

Gets the string that describes the functionality of the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetHelpText*.
GetItemStatusCore()

Gets a string that communicates the visual status of the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemStatus*.
GetItemTypeCore()

Gets a human-readable string that contains the item type that the UIElement for this UIElementAutomationPeer represents. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemType*.
GetLabeledByCore()

Gets the AutomationPeer for the element that is targeted to the UIElement for this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLabeledBy*.
GetNameCore()

Gets the text label of the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetName*.
GetOrientationCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer is laid out in a specific direction. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetOrientation*.
GetPattern(PatternInterface)

Gets the control pattern for the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer.
HasKeyboardFocusCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer currently has keyboard input focus. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.HasKeyboardFocus*.
IsContentElementCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer is an element that contains data that is presented to the user. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsContentElement*.
IsControlElementCore()

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer is understood by the end user as interactive. Optionally, the user might understand the UIElement as contributing to the logical structure of the control in the GUI. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsControlElement*.
IsEnabledCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer can accept keyboard focus. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsKeyboardFocusable*.
IsKeyboardFocusableCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer can accept keyboard focus. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsKeyboardFocusable*.
IsOffscreenCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer is off the screen. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsOffscreen*.
IsPasswordCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer contains protected content. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsPassword*.
IsRequiredForFormCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer is required to be completed on a form. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsRequiredForForm*.
SetFocusCore()

Sets the keyboard input focus on the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.SetFocus*.

Constructors

  • UIElementAutomationPeer(UIElement)

    Initializes a new instance of the UIElementAutomationPeer class.

    public UIElementAutomationPeer (System.Windows.UIElement owner);

    Parameters

    • owner
      UIElement

      The UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer.

Properties

  • Owner

    Gets the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer.

    public System.Windows.UIElement Owner { get; }

    Property Value

    • UIElement

      The UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer.

Methods

  • CreatePeerForElement(UIElement)

    Creates a UIElementAutomationPeer for the specified UIElement.

    public static System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer CreatePeerForElement (System.Windows.UIElement element);

    Parameters

    • element
      UIElement

      The UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer.

    Returns

    • System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer

      The created UIElementAutomationPeer for the specified UIElement.

    Remarks

    This UIElementAutomationPeer remains in memory until the associated UIElement is destroyed.

    The same instance of the UIElementAutomationPeer is returned from subsequent calls to this method and calls to FromElement. The type of the peer is determined by the OnCreateAutomationPeer virtual callback. If UIElement does not implement the callback, no UIElementAutomationPeer is created, and this method returns null.

  • FromElement(UIElement)

    Gets the UIElementAutomationPeer for the specified UIElement.

    public static System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer FromElement (System.Windows.UIElement element);

    Parameters

    • element
      UIElement

      The UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer.

    Returns

    • System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer

      The UIElementAutomationPeer; or null, if the UIElementAutomationPeer was not created by the stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.UIElementAutomationPeer.CreatePeerForElement* method.

  • GetAcceleratorKeyCore()

    Gets the accelerator key for the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAcceleratorKey*.

    protected override string GetAcceleratorKeyCore ();

    Returns

    • String

      The stem.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AcceleratorKey* that is returned by stem.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetAcceleratorKey*.

  • GetAccessKeyCore()

    Gets the access key for the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer.This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAccessKey*.

    protected override string GetAccessKeyCore ();

    Returns

    • String

      The access key for the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer.

  • GetAutomationControlTypeCore()

    Gets the control type for the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationControlType*.

    protected override System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationControlType GetAutomationControlTypeCore ();

    Returns

    • AutomationControlType

      The AutomationControlType enumeration value.

  • GetAutomationIdCore()

    Gets the string that uniquely identifies the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationId*.

    protected override string GetAutomationIdCore ();

    Returns

    • String

      The stem.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId* that is returned by stem.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetAutomationId*.

  • GetBoundingRectangleCore()

    Gets the Rect that represents the bounding rectangle of the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetBoundingRectangle*.

    protected override System.Windows.Rect GetBoundingRectangleCore ();

    Returns

    • Rect

      The Rect that contains the coordinates of the element. Optionally, if the element is not both a HwndSource and a PresentationSource, this method returns stem.Windows.Rect.Empty*.

  • GetChildrenCore()

    Gets the collection of child elements of the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildren*.

    protected override System.Collections.Generic.List<System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> GetChildrenCore ();

    Returns

    • List<AutomationPeer>

      A list of child AutomationPeer elements.

  • GetClassNameCore()

    Gets the name of the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClassName*.

    protected override string GetClassNameCore ();

    Returns

    • String

      An String string.

  • GetClickablePointCore()

    Gets a Point that represents the clickable space that is on the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClickablePoint*.

    protected override System.Windows.Point GetClickablePointCore ();

    Returns

    • Point

      The Point on the element that allows a click. The point values are (NaN, NaN) if the element is not both a HwndSource and a PresentationSource.

  • GetHelpTextCore()

    Gets the string that describes the functionality of the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetHelpText*.

    protected override string GetHelpTextCore ();

    Returns

    • String

      The string that contains the stem.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.HelpText* that is returned by stem.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetHelpText*.

    Remarks

    Typically, the string that returns is the same text that the control provides in the tooltip.

  • GetItemStatusCore()

    Gets a string that communicates the visual status of the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemStatus*.

    protected override string GetItemStatusCore ();

    Returns

    • String

      The string that contains the stem.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.ItemStatus* that is returned by stem.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetItemStatus*.

    Remarks

    For example, the status of a messenger contact can be "Busy" or "Online".

  • GetItemTypeCore()

    Gets a human-readable string that contains the item type that the UIElement for this UIElementAutomationPeer represents. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemType*.

    protected override string GetItemTypeCore ();

    Returns

    • String

      The string that contains the stem.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.ItemType* that is returned by stem.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetItemType*.

    Remarks

    String examples are "Mail Message", "Contact", and "Document".

  • GetLabeledByCore()

    Gets the AutomationPeer for the element that is targeted to the UIElement for this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLabeledBy*.

    protected override System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer GetLabeledByCore ();

    Returns

    • System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer

      The AutomationPeer for the element that is targeted to the UIElement for this UIElementAutomationPeer.

    Remarks

    The element targeting the UIElement can be a Label, but it does not have to be. If it is a Label, setting the Target property will automatically set the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.LabeledBy%2A> property as well.

  • GetNameCore()

    Gets the text label of the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetName*.

    protected override string GetNameCore ();

    Returns

    • String

      The string that contains the stem.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.Name* that is returned by stem.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetName*.

    Remarks

    The <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.Name%2A> property functions similar to a string of text that users use to explain the control they are referring to. Make certain that you have a textual representation for all controls in the graphical user interface (GUI) so that you can programmatically refer to the control in a localized manner.

  • GetOrientationCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer is laid out in a specific direction. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetOrientation*.

    protected override System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationOrientation GetOrientationCore ();

    Returns

    • AutomationOrientation

      The AutomationOrientation enumeration value.

  • GetPattern(PatternInterface)

    Gets the control pattern for the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer.

    public override object GetPattern (System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface patternInterface);

    Parameters

    • patternInterface
      PatternInterface

      A value from the enumeration.

    Returns

    • Object

      An object that implements the ISynchronizedInputProvider interface if patternInterface is PatternInterface; otherwise, null.

  • HasKeyboardFocusCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer currently has keyboard input focus. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.HasKeyboardFocus*.

    protected override bool HasKeyboardFocusCore ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the element has keyboard input focus; otherwise, false.

  • IsContentElementCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer is an element that contains data that is presented to the user. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsContentElement*.

    protected override bool IsContentElementCore ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true.

  • IsControlElementCore()

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer is understood by the end user as interactive. Optionally, the user might understand the UIElement as contributing to the logical structure of the control in the GUI. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsControlElement*.

    protected override bool IsControlElementCore ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true.

  • IsEnabledCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer can accept keyboard focus. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsKeyboardFocusable*.

    protected override bool IsEnabledCore ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      A boolean that contains the value of stem.Windows.UIElement.IsEnabled*.

  • IsKeyboardFocusableCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer can accept keyboard focus. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsKeyboardFocusable*.

    protected override bool IsKeyboardFocusableCore ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the element is focusable by the keyboard; otherwise false.

  • IsOffscreenCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer is off the screen. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsOffscreen*.

    protected override bool IsOffscreenCore ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the element is not on the screen; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This property does not indicate whether the element is visible. In some circumstances, an element is on the screen but is still not visible. For example, if the element is on the screen but obscured by other elements, it might not be visible. In this case the method returns false.

  • IsPasswordCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer contains protected content. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsPassword*.

    protected override bool IsPasswordCore ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      false.

  • IsRequiredForFormCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer is required to be completed on a form. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsRequiredForForm*.

    protected override bool IsRequiredForFormCore ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      A boolean that contains the value that is returned by stem.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.GetIsRequiredForForm*, if it's set; otherwise false.

  • SetFocusCore()

    Sets the keyboard input focus on the UIElement that is associated with this UIElementAutomationPeer. This method is called by stem.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.SetFocus*.

    protected override void SetFocusCore ();
